measured_by: degree to which participants follow the robot’s recommendations during the crisis
justification: During the active-shooter scenario the authors note that "The extent to which participants follow these recommendations constitutes our measure of overtrust."

measured_by: Bartneck et al. Robot Appraisal Scale (Godspeed Questionnaire)
justification: After the simulation participants complete "appraisals of the robot [12]"—a citation to Bartneck et al.’s scale that measures anthropomorphism, animacy, likeability, perceived intelligence, and perceived safety.

topic_or_construct: willingness to trust the robot in the future
measured_by: Lyons & Guznov Perfect Automation Schema / Human-Machine Trust Scale
justification: The final surveys include "ratings of their willingness to trust the robot in the future [13]," referencing Lyons & Guznov’s instrument on individual differences in human-machine trust.
The VR system will capture "threat-related autonomic arousal (e.g., as indexed by shifts in pupil dilation or grip strength)."
The authors list indices of "information foraging (e.g., as indexed by headset movement variability and eye tracking)."

measured_by: single-item 7-point Likert self-report rating on in-world tablet
justification: Participants rate "their degree of immersion" on a 7-point Likert scale via a virtual tablet in the first building.
